Also, GLaDOS. RATING: 9 out of 10

Awesome game!

Portal was the start of a phenomenon. One of the best puzzle games out there, it is topped only by its sequel, Portal 2. Humerous writing, brain-teasing test chambers, and a story that truly draws you in.

I highly recommend playing this game. And if you enjoy this, get Portal 2 as well.
Geniale, neue Spielidee - perfekte Story.
Ridiculously awesome. Possibly Game of the Decade. Play it.
I guess simple minds get excited of stupid concepts am i the only one in the world that is not amazed by this most Dull and booring experience ever? this game blows cock.
An FPS puzzle game with a hilarious villan, Portal really blew me away.

One of my favorite games. This single-player, first-person shooter style game is insanely creative, but at the same time easily beaten if you yourself are also insanely creative. Unique game mechanics, difficult puzzles and hilarious dialogue (not so much of your own) easily makes this one of the best games I have ever played. Could be longer, but luckily, Portal 2 comes in with some fresh new ideas and features.
A Must.

In an age where games have mega graphics and ever increasingly complex customisations to cater to every players possible want or need, its nice to play a game where less is more. Once you grasp the concept of how the mechanics work you really do start thinking with portal! What makes this game better though is the writing and pacing of the levels, making it a definate 'must play' game!
no os lo perdais!!! ^_^ una pasada!!
This game is a masterpiece! Fun puzzle-solving with an epic story.
Criativo! A história do bolo é ótima!

Brilliant

I don't think this game needs an introduction.

Great game, couldn't stress enough how good this game is.

It was incredibly innovative for it's time and it still is mind blowing. It could be considered a landmark in gaming history, featuring great graphics, great gameplay and the best inanimate villain\narrator of all time.

This is a game that you absolutely HAVE to play if you are even remotely interested in "games".

It's short, it's smart and it's challenging, but I doubt there is anybody who still doesn't know what Portal is.

Give it a try!
An awesome classic!!!

A great FPS puzzle game with a dark sense of humor. It seems to have near universal appeal, along with a diverse fanbase. It has been called 'too short' by many, but I think of it as 'just enough'. I recommend it for anyone with basic FPS experience, and a slightly twisted sense of humor.

Unique!

This is a short game. But it's also a very tightly designed game, with excellent pacing, good narative delivered in an intriguing indirect way, and lots of clever little details. Humorous and the whole cake business is not the be-all and end-all of the humour. Works an original mechanic to its very limit.

Portal was, and still is, a brilliant first person puzzle game. It had humor, an excellent story, cool gameplay and above all, some really insane puzzles. I seriously had more problems with some of these puzzles than the puzzles in Portal 2. Portal is all about the experience and believe me if I say it will be an experience you won't soon forget. I don't know why I even wrote this... I'm positive practically everyone has already played it. But still... if you haven't... make sure you do !

[Rating: 90/100]
for some reason the tf2 lady turned into a robot so you have to kill her
Pretty fun and challenging game
Grande jogo, a Valve sempre surpreendendo. Um dos meus favoritos.

I probably can't say anything that hasn't already been said about Portal, so I'm just going to say that it is addicting.  There is a bit of a learning curve, especially with respect to manipulating portals and learning to solve intricate puzzles in first-person perspective.  But the game's gentle difficulty introduces you to new techniques steadily, without overwhelming you.  The game doesn't even truly start becoming difficult until mid-way through, about the time all of the skills you have learned in previous stages start coming together.  There are some real brain-teasers in the later levels, and it's easy to become stuck.  However, it's always possible to find the correct solution with thought and experimentation.  Don't be afraid to try something!  The game is a winner all the way through the confrontation with GlaDOS at the end.  If you haven't tried Portal, you're missing out on something special.  Do yourself a favor and grab it now.
２度も無料で配られたんだから持ってるでしょ

Come for the cultural references. Stay for the epicness of the story and gameplay mechanics.

Portal practically invented the puzzle-shooter genre single-handedly, and still stands the test of time even after the launch of its sequel. Worth a play for anyone that loves games that make you think.
:) só isso

Che dire... È Portal, e ormai lo conosciamo tutti. 5 ore di puzzle a base di portali, in cui la protagonista deve superare le stanze di test a cui verrà sottoposta, con la guida di Glados, un'intelligenza artificiale nota a tutti come una delle migliori personalità in un videogioco. L'unica arma è una pistola che spara due tipi diversi di portali, consentendovi di riapparire da una parte all'altra del livello. Enigmi ingegnosi, mai troppo ostici e danno soddisfazione. Geniale.
虽然我玩这游戏感觉晕晕的，但这是个很考人的好游戏
it is a great game for single player. and it is made out of cake!

I find the controls a little spacey at times (or maybe because I'm getting nauseous as I'm hurtling through infinite space). The Source engine does start to look a little dated, but this just means smooth gameplay on modern machines. The game length is a little short and the more challenging stuff is only for the truly dedicated. It's a very neat concept and I look forward to P2 when it goes on sale! Score: 7/10.
This game is a little too easy. 6/10
The cake is NOT a fucking lie.
Awesome.
If you've not played Portal before, then you should play it now.
Juegazo

Portal™ - новая игра от Valve для одного игрока. Portal, действие которого происходит в загадочных лабораториях компании Aperture, был назван одной из самых инновационных игр современности и предлагает вниманию игрока множество часов непохожей ни на что головоломки.
логическая игра где нужно напрячь извилину,
Игра просто порталган! 10 из 10
If  You like Puzzle Games then this is the game for you!
혁명전인 퍼즐게임 하지 않겠는가!!
If you don't have this game, or have never played it, get it now! It is currently free, most likely to promote upcoming DLC for the sequel, but still nether-the-less. Must play game!

Easily one of the best games I've ever invested in. Although extremely short, Portal uses the unique idea of shooting two portals onto surfaces around "testing chambers" that you are being held in. Only clean surfaces can hold a portal, and sometimes you need items to get past locked doors and such. Anyone who likes puzzle games, or is just plain sick of boring old CoD, step right up and buy this game. I garuantee it will be worth your while.

Wow, just wow. For a title that’s only two hours long (give or take), Portal is an exemplary game that keeps drawing you back to play it through again and again. The simple and yet brilliant premise of portal-based puzzle solving plus a simple and yet brilliantly well told story dripping with black comedy is an odd combo that somehow works to turn this game into a modern masterpiece, one of the first for the gaming world. A must have for everybody, not just gamers. This game not only is fun, but it also tests your mind, something that even parents can get into. Dive on in, and get ready for a portal-hopping good time!
Essential to expanding your mind.

I. LOVE. THIS. GAME.
Words cannot describe how amazingly original and fantastic this game really is. There really is no other game quite like it, the way the story unfolds, the subtle tie-ins to the Half Life universe, and the unusual villan of the story (my favorite part, in fact). What would you do if you could create wormholes that could be placed on flat surfaces and used to travel between two points while conserving your inertia between entering and exiting them? This game will show you. It will twist your head around, and it will confuse you. You will need to re-learn how to play a first person shooter, but I guarentee afterward, you will truely "be thinking with portals".
Apparently there are still people that haven't played this gem.
Puzzle solving ACTUALLY for the 21st century. A blast. HIGHLY recommended, even if it only took me <10 hours.
...the Frampton Comes Alive of video games, everyone has, or should have, it. One of the most entertaining games i've ever played.
Volevo parlarvi di questo gioco, ma ho ancora molti gatti e molte scatole. E il carico di neurotossine è appena arrivato.

Engaging, intelligent gameplay with the best use of Source based physics I have seen thus far.  A must buy if you are a fan of the Source engine, and the commentary from GLADDOS is the icing on the... well, you'll just have to find out!
Potentially the greatest game of all time.

This game is quite a fun challenge, it certainly gets you thinking as you try to solve the puzzles.  Not to mention there're those little details out there that're worth looking for.  I'd recommend buying it and seeing it for yourself.

play it all the way through, its rewarding, not just a puzzle FPS, the cake is a lie ;)
thanks to MR.Roboto for giving me this game i really wanted it so badly so he gave me it for a couple of tf2 items
It's fucking portal nuff said.

Portal provides you with a really great and unique experience. The main campaign is short (about two hours), but every step you take there  feels logical and necessary, which all finally build up to a great finale. In this game there is no drag; every map, every item, every single little detail teaches you new stuff or adds to this unique atmosphere. The story is told subtly and makes the game become even more immersive. Given that Valve has included extra challenges and the fact that  lots of custom maps (which range from bad to really good in quality) are available all over the internet relativise the short campaign length. And believe me, you'll want to play through the campaign a second time a lot sooner than you think anyway.
